title: Database Overview
text:
Clip Summary
The database currently includes 22 video clips, each drawn from a different English-language film and ranging from 130 to 425 seconds in duration (Mdn=238, MAD=96.4). The table below presents each clip’s abbreviation, source film title (and release year), as well as starting and stopping timestamp in HH:MM:SS format, and duration in seconds.

Each clip was continuously rated on its emotional valence at a frequency of 1 Hz and using a scale ranging from -4 (very negative) to 4 (very positive). The number of participants rating each clip ranged from 27 to 36 (Mdn=30, MAD=1.5). The table below provides the number of raters and duration per clip as well as a summary of the valence ratings distribution across raters (i.e., mean, standard deviation, and quartiles).

clip_summary |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = Raters)) + 
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_y_discrete() +
  scale_x_continuous(
    limits = c(25, 37),
    breaks = seq(0, 40, 2),
    expand = c(0, 0)
  ) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Number of Raters")




Examine distribution of ratings (across videos, seconds, and raters)

ggplot(ratings, aes(x = Rating)) + 
  geom_histogram(breaks = seq(-4, 4, 1/3), color = "white")




Examine distribution of ratings per rater (across videos and seconds)

ratings |> 
  mutate(Rater = fct_reorder(.f = factor(Rater), .x = Rating, na.rm = TRUE)) |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = Rating, y = Rater)) + 
  geom_boxplot()




Examine distribution of ratings per video (across seconds and raters)

title: Prepare Ratings
text:
Prepare continuous (CARMA) ratings

# Find all rating files
carma_files <- 
  dir(
    path = "./data/Carma_Rating_Results", 
    pattern = "*.xlsx", 
    full.names = TRUE
  )


# Read in all rating files
carma_raw <- 
  map_dfr(
    .x = carma_files, 
    .f = read_xlsx, 
    skip = 7, 
    .name_repair = ~str_remove_all(., "[:space:]"), 
    .id = "Video"
  ) |> 
  select(
    Video, 
    Second, 
    starts_with("MW")
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    Video = parse_integer(Video),
    Second = as.integer(Second),
    Film = factor(
      Video, 
      levels = seq_along(carma_files), 
      labels = str_extract(
        string = basename(carma_files), 
        pattern = "[^_]+"
      )
    ),
    .before = 1
  )


# Reshape and sort data
carma_tidy <- 
  carma_raw |> 
  pivot_longer(
    cols = starts_with("MW"), 
    names_to = "Rater", 
    values_to = "Rating",
    names_transform = parse_number
  ) |> 
  mutate(Rater = as.integer(Rater)) |> 
  arrange(Video, Rater, Second) |> 
  select(Film, Video, Rater, Second, Rating)


# Write data as a compressed RDS file
write_rds(carma_tidy, file = "./data/ratings_tidy.rds", compress = "gz")

title: Prepare Ratings
text:
Prepare holistic ratings

redcap_raw <- read_xlsx("./data/redcap_cleaned.xlsx") |> print()
